conflictDescription: User Story A expects ALFRED to suggest hard exercises (start challenging games), while User Story B forbids challenging memory games and wants only simple ones, creating opposing instructions for the same operation of suggesting games.
userStoryASummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to suggest hard physical and cognitive exercises so I can challenge myself and stay motivated.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to avoid challenging memory games and only use very simple ones to feel comfortable and not overwhelmed.
cluster: Strict Privacy Control over Data Sharing
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to introduce context-aware adaptation, allowing ALFRED to suggest exercise difficulty based on the user's current comfort and motivation levels, resolving the start-forbid conflict.
newUserStoryASummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to suggest challenging exercises when I feel motivated, so I can push my physical and cognitive limits safely.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to suggest only simple memory games when I feel overwhelmed, so I can stay comfortable and engaged.

conflictDescription: User Story A expects the system to start challenging physical-cognitive games to boost motivation, while User Story B forbids challenging exercises and only allows simple games upon user request, imposing opposite expectations on system behavior regarding game complexity.
userStoryASummary: As an older person with mild mobility issues, I want to play hard challenge games combining physical and cognitive tasks to boost my motivation and improve.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to only play very simple memory games when I ask, so I avoid any challenging exercises and keep control over my participation.
resolutionDescription: Applied a contextual policy layer to reconcile conflicting expectations by allowing challenging games only upon user consent, while simple games remain default to preserve user control.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older person with mild mobility issues, I want to play challenging physical-cognitive games when I choose, so that I can boost motivation and improve.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to play simple memory games by default and only engage in challenging exercises upon request, so that I maintain control over participation.

conflictDescription: User Story A expects the system to start and provide challenging physical-cognitive games, while User Story B forbids any game suggestions, directly contradicting the operation triggered by the same event of engaging with games.
userStoryASummary: As an older person with mild mobility issues, I want to play hard challenge games combining physical and cognitive tasks to boost my motivation and improve.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to block all social activity and game suggestions to avoid overwhelming and challenging interactions.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to apply contextual policy layering, allowing challenging games only when the user is willing and not overwhelmed, and blocking games in cases of overload.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older person with mild mobility issues, I want to play challenging physical-cognitive games when motivated, so that I can improve my health.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to block game suggestions when feeling overwhelmed, so that I avoid stressful interactions.

conflictDescription: User Story A expects the system to allow freely choosing harder exercises (start/challenge), while User Story B forbids challenging exercises by preferring only simple games on user request, imposing opposite instructions on exercise difficulty and system control.
userStoryASummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want to choose harder exercises freely so I can challenge myself without ALFRED restricting me.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to only play very simple memory games when I ask, so I avoid any challenging exercises and keep control over my participation.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story B is updated to allow challenging exercises only when explicitly requested, while User Story A remains unchanged to support free choice of harder exercises.
newUserStoryASummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want to choose harder exercises freely so I can challenge myself without ALFRED restricting me.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to play only simple memory games by default and try harder exercises only when I explicitly request them, so I keep control over my participation.
